articles.author: RPS
articles.description:
It was a rainy day when she walked into my office, hard rain, like stray stones from a truck on the highway hitting your car bonnet. I lit my cyber-cigarette and put my feet on my desk, I don't know why, I thought it would make me look nonchalant to this strange woman. She wasn't impressed. "Detective," she said, glaring at me with eyes like gorgeous tennis balls, "I want to open today's advent calendar door." I was confused. "Whaddya wanna do that for, missy?" She sat back, relaxed, and pulled a gun from her purse. "I need to stuff a body into it."
Read more
articles.title: The RPS Advent Calendar 2024, December 22nd

articles.author: RPS
articles.description:
There's a slight breeze and a comforting glow coming from the crack's in today's calendar door, the sound of merriment and many accents from all over the world. Better join in the campfire revelry, because whoever's there won't be staying for long.
Read more
articles.title: The RPS Advent Calendar 2024, December 21st

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Happy weekend all. Due to the intervention of Dark Powers and also, half the Treehouse already being on holiday, we neglected to do a round-up of staff Xmas plays before signing off for the year. Well, I’m pretty sure nobody did one. I can’t see anything scheduled in the RPS Post-A-Tron, but the RPS Post-A-Tron is an unreliable beast, full of malice and deceit. If I publish this and it turns out we have two, please divide into rival factions and have a comments war over which is the real one. Apologies! Normal service will resume next year.
 
Read more
articles.title: What are we all playing this holiday?

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
"A tactically rich turn-based game with some meaty role-playing elements", was how Staff Sergeant James Archer characterised his Menace hands-on, back in September. The only thing missing from his account of the game was the bread needed to make that rich, meaty concoction a tasty, nourishing sandwich.
And by bread, I of course mean the strategic layer - the parts between the turn-based battles where you pick your next mission, improve your squads, deal with pop-up story events, appraise your standing with each NPC faction, and equip your strike cruiser with auxiliary systems. Developers Overhype have now shared a few details of how it all works. Mmmmm, such malty, yeasty strategicalness.
 
Read more
articles.title: Here's how the strategy layer works in Menace, the turn-based squad combat RPG from the Battle Brothers devs

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
I’m hoping you’ll forgive a spot of mission-bending here, given Should You Bother With? Is usually intended to test out the new and the strange of gaming hardware. Instead, I want to talk about mini PCs – not just small-form-factor desktops, but properly tiny, box o’ chocolates-sized computers – which have, of course, been around for decades.
Recently, however, I’ve been wondering if mini PCs are finally on the cusp of having their moment as serious games machines. Between rising desktop component prices and ever-ballooning electricity bills, it would make sense that a smaller, cheaper system would take on a new appeal, and the success of handhelds like the Steam Deck and Asus ROG Ally show that convenience still trumps out-and-out performance for a lot of PC players. There have even been hints that Valve are resurrecting their Steam Machine mini PC concept, years after a flopping first attempt. Should you be interested?
Read more
articles.title: Should you bother with... mini PCs?

articles.author: Sin Vega
articles.description:
Clambering deep out of the Contemplation Pit, where reading reviews or opinions or, god help you, Takes, is forbidden, I am curious to learn how people have been categorising Songs of Silence. Its structure most resembles Songs of Conquest or Heroes of Might and/or Magic, but with little RPG emphasis or base building, and minimal tactical fighting.
Taxonomy is arbitrary and often unimportant at the end of the day, but I am very glad to firmly rule it out of one category: It's not a bloody card game. It looks like one, sure. You do most things with cards, and characters acquire more cards over time. But even if you absolutely, utterly, and correctly loathe card-based systems, this game has none.
Read more
articles.title: Rally Point: Oh phew, Songs of Silence is only pretending to be a card game

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Early on in Terry Pratchett's novel The Light Fantastic, a spell is cast to map the world. It begins as a "fireball of occult potentiality," dangling in the Great Hall of the Unseen University, which evolves into a ghostly "embryo universe." The embryo expands "lightly as a thought," with spectral continents "sleeting" through walls and people. It surges across the landscape until the entire population and geography of the Disc is exactly duplicated and enclosed by a shimmering shadow-self of "shining threads that followed every movement."

 
Read more
articles.title: Microsoft Flight Simulator and the quest to replace Earth

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
Two men on the board of directors for Epic Games have stepped down from their positions after the US Department of Justice investigated the board under antitrust laws. The pair of directors were originally appointed to Epic's board by Tencent (who slurp upon a minority stake in the Unreal Engine company) but the United States government took a look at this and said: ah-ah-ah, you're not allowed to have a director in your boardroom if they're already fingers-deep in the pie of a competing company. Naughty Tencent! Naughty Epic! And, yes, naughty Riot Games!
Read more
articles.title: Two Epic Games directors step down after US Department of Justice investigate games companies under antitrust laws

articles.author: RPS
articles.description:
Ahhh, the lap of the ocean is calming isn't it? And it's really warm here, too. What's interesting is that the sounds of the sea are occasionally masked by the sounds of multiple segways. Weird.

 
Read more
articles.title: The RPS Advent Calendar 2024, December 20th

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
Steam sales aren't the drop-everything-and-grab-yer-wallet events they used to be, according to you lot. The Winter sale that began yesterday is almost identical to the Autumn sale that ended just two weeks ago, for example. But you can still find one or two gifts if you bore deep enough into the ice. Me? I'm only interested in one thing. How many of these games are snowy and chilly enough to induce wonderful hypothermia? I'm on a frostbitten quest to find out. Here are the most winter-iest games you can pick up for cheap.
Read more
articles.title: Here are 5 snowy games you can get for cheap in the Winter Steam sale

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
Open that bottle of space champagne, the aliens have been wiped out. At least that's what the interstellar pilots of Elite Dangerous are celebrating in the galaxy-sized multiplayer space sim. Earlier this month, the Thargoid menace finally landed in the Sol system, putting earth itself under threat for the first time, not to mention other human homeworlds and colonies. This meant players were invited to drop everything and head for home - to embark on one last great stand against the final, desperate, and dangerous alien attacker: a Thargoid Titan called "Cocijo". Don't worry, they got him.
Read more
articles.title: After 7 years of alien war, Elite Dangerous pilots have finally defeated the Thargoids

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Frostpunk developers 11 bit studios have cancelled a new, console-oriented game in response to both "shifting market trends" - in particular, declining player enthusiasm for "narrative-driven, story-rich games" - and specific problems during development. As a consequence, a number of 11 bit staff are going to lose their jobs, though at least half of the affected development team are being offered the chance to move to other projects, including a few unannounced ones.

 
Read more
articles.title: Frostpunk creators cancel "Project 8" and lay off staff amid concerns that "narrative-driven, story-rich games" don't sell

articles.author: Sophie Glass
articles.description:
At any given moment I am in the center of a wonderful vortex of skeletons. Bones splash and rattle and burst out of the ground in sharp, horrible spurs. My weakest skeletons, sensing their death coming, explode into fire and shards. My strongest skeletons fight so hard and with such alacrity that upon dying, they drag their spirits together and keep fighting as ghosts for a while. Foul little bone scorpions skitter around on fans of legs made from human hands. Somewhere in the middle, almost invisible among the noise, is the character I am actually playing: Path of Exile 2’s mean-spirited, callous, and gleefully enjoyable Witch.
This is a review in progress. It has to be. Even in its incomplete early access period, Path of Exile 2 is a great sprawling mass of a game. Three meaty acts of a planned six act campaign are followed by a trickier return tour through them, before the absurd endgame kicks into gear and the real work begins. If I came to you having played everything on offer I would be wild-haired, bloodshot-eyed and possessing perfect, incomprehensible knowledge. Let’s compromise: I have toured the dark caverns and the antediluvian crypts. I have been killed by various accumulated nasties. I’ve had a great time.
Read more
articles.title: Path Of Exile 2 early access review: an expressive, characterful ARPG with plenty to chew on

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
The announcement of The Witcher 4 with The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt's Ciri as protagonist has attracted a bit of discussion. Some of the reaction is online toddlers waxing wroth about a video game having a (somewhat older!!!) woman as lead character, and especially, shock, a video game in a series that has hitherto starred a man. And some of it is people commenting more thoughtfully on whether Ciri genuinely makes for a suitable Witcher protagonist, given that she isn't the product of the typical Witcher genetic modification regime (which is heavily tailored towards men), and given that, without spoiling too much, she has gifts that make crumbly old Geralt's sword-and-sorcery skillset look rather paltry. 


Speaking to Eurogamer this week, game director Sebastian Kalemba and narrative director Philipp Weber responded to a few of these comments, and also shared a little about Ciri's situation at the start of the game.
 
Read more
articles.title: Having Ciri as The Witcher 4 lead will help the game explore the Witcher world's sexism, say CD Projekt

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
"We are a people who honour democracy," said the dog, scratching himself. "Per our custom, you may drink of our fresh water." The dog was called Senator Umeshefaat, and he was very civil, even if he was shedding his black and white fur everywhere. We spoke in his home village at dawn. Later, I examined the senator's personal history more thoroughly and discovered he was "hated by bears for cooking them a rancid meal." I suppose every politician has their enemies. 
That Caves Of Qud creates fun anecdotes out of simple encounters shouldn't be a surprise. It has had 15 years of early access to establish itself as a small-but-mighty story generating roguelike of repute (there's a reason it sits deservedly side-by-side with Dwarf Fortress in the same publishing house). After creating many characters, and dying and dying and dying again, I understand why it grips the brain with such fierce glee. It is a machine of grand imagination and adventuresome comedy. A deceptively powerful RPG that isn't half as obtuse to newcomers as the screenshots make it out to be. Qud's low-res bark is just a complement to its bite.
Read more
articles.title: Caves Of Qud review: an obscenely rich roguelike realm you could get lost in for months

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Insults are so serious, these days. They're all so insulting, whereas the kinds of insult I cherish are the ones that coax a belly laugh from both the roaster and the roastee. Here are a few stupid putdowns I've found or made up specially for Xmas, organised into tiers of savagery.
Read more
articles.title: Here is a page of insults

articles.author: RPS
articles.description:
Huh, it's a little hard to breathe today, don't you think? Like the air's a bit thin. Anyway, I have a job I need to get to and there's this guy who's going to mentor me on my first day. A guy called Mo, who seems nice but isn't particularly talkative. Prefers paper and pencil. 

 
Read more
articles.title: The RPS Advent Calendar 2024, December 19th

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
It's been rumoured for a while that Sony are about to buy Kadokawa Corporation, a monolithic Japanese media conglomerate that means nothing to the bulk of you unless I append the magic words "parent company of Dark Souls developers FromSoftware" and possibly also, "parent company of Spike Chunsoft". Sony and Kadokawa were reported to be in talks last month, fomenting all sorts of speculation about, say, the PC version of Bloodborne being ritually sacrificed to consecrate the PS6-exclusivity of Dark Souls 4. Now, the pair have emerged from the Cave of Haggling and announced... "a strategic capital and business alliance agreement". What does this mean? Is it safe to scream yet?
 
Read more
articles.title: After much talk of an acquisition, Sony and FromSoftware parent Kadokawa announce "strategic alliance"

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
They say hope is the first step on the road to disappointment, and reader, I’ve made a pretty damn big step. Previously, on my mission to survive S.T.A.L.K.E.R. 2: Heart of Chornobyl with only wild mutants as my weapons, I’d discovered clues that someone else was attempting to tame the Zone’s beastly inhabitants. With one of their electronic tracking collars in hand and absolutely no preexisting knowledge of their location, I set out to find this kindred spirit, only for the Zone to once again slam a door in my face.
A cold, steel, very literal door to boot. It turns out that the scientist’s laboratory is locked up tight, and will remain so until I delve about twenty hours deeper into the faction war that’s bubbled up while I’ve been running around throwing irradiated rats at people in tracksuits. Fine. Fine! But I’m keeping the collar.
Read more
articles.title: The Beastmaster of S.T.A.L.K.E.R. 2, part four: the last bite

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
Fists up, a big fighting game mod is due out this weekend. Marvel vs Capcom Infinite came out in 2017 and got some flak for its plastic figurine art style. But this year a modder began work on an overhaul that would grant the game pretty cel-shaded visuals. Since then the modding team has grown to 40 people and the scope of the mod's features has ballooned. It's now going to include new moves, stages, costumes, and a chaotic-looking 2v2 multiplayer tag team mode. All good news for biff 'em up sickos, as the mod is due to release on Friday. 
Read more
articles.title: Spider-Punk lands in Marvel vs Capcom Infinite thanks to a giant mod with a revamped art style and new modes out this week

articles.author: RPS
articles.description:
Today's Advent Calendar might take you quite some time to polish off. It's ridiculously dense, darkly majestic, and popular among masochists. Come then, touch the withered arm and be transported behind door number 18...
Read more
articles.title: The RPS Advent Calendar 2024, December 18th

articles.author: Ed Thorn
articles.description:
First revealed all the way back in December 2023, Archetype Entertainment and Blur Studio's sci-fi action adventure Exodus hit us with a few things: Matthew McConaughey is involved, it looks a bit like Mass Effect, it's being developed by BioWare veterans, and it loves a bit of time dilation. In October of this year, we got a look at some icky celestial faction and zero in the way of actual gameplay. And now? Now we finally get a look at how you do things. Like sucker-punching armoured space bears in the face with electro-pistols.

 
Read more
articles.title: Mass Effect-like Exodus's first gameplay video features duels with space bears and chats with thankful frogs

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
After much teasing, the vicious tyrants of Arrowhead Games and their noxious puppets, the "democratic government" of Super Earth, have announced the very first Helldivers 2 licensed crossover. In yet another hollow display of solidarity and "Liber-tea", they've teamed up with the loathsome fascists of Killzone, the elderly shooter series from Sony and Guerrilla Games.
From today, you'll be able to buy weapons, armour and cosmetics belonging to Killzone's despicable stormtroopers from the Helldivers Superstore, and there's the suggestion of an additional Killzone-themed reward depending on the fortunes of the so-called Galactic War, a xenocidal bloodbath couched as an exercise in bringing "freedom" to the upstanding socialist Automatons, the blameless wildlife of the Tyranids, and the Wellsian cosplayers of the recently added Illuminate faction.
We here at Rock Paper Shotgun stand against Super Earth and Arrowhead's wanton aggression, which absolutely isn't a big satirical joke based on some Verhoeven film or other. Anyway, those capes. Find an image and further details below.
 
Read more
articles.title: Helldivers 2's first licensed crossover is also Killzone's official debut on PC, sort of

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Times Of Progress is a special game for me, because it's the first news tip I have ever received from Sin Vega, Prime Minister of Strategy Gaming. Sin once described writing news articles for our former news editor Alice0 (RPS in peace) as like practising backflips in front of the kung fu master. Writing about a new city builder at Sin's suggestion is like being invited to budget the development of Londinium by Julius Caesar.
The terror of screwing it up - together with other, more trivial distractions, like international games industry conferences - has stopped me from writing about Times Of Progress for months. Today I bite the bullet, and emerge from my lodgings to issue a hesitant speech to the masses, hoping like hell that Caesar is too preoccupied with the latest Gaul uprising to notice my errors.
 
Read more
articles.title: Times Of Progress is an elegant, focussed city builder set during the Industrial Revolution

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Toy Box sounds like a very Xmassy game, but then you watch a trailer, and realise that it is not very Xmassy at all. It's a free visual novel with a macabre puzzling element. The setup is that you're a toy inspector working for a jovial Grand Toy Maker, his face hidden above the top of the screen. Your job is to disassemble toys - five in all - according to his eldritch written instructions, and either "salvage" them or "sentence" them to the incinerator.
 Read more
articles.title: I can't bear to play much of free horror game Toy Box, but I love the concept of pulling talking toys apart

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Great was the adulation last week when FromSoftware announced a new Elden Ring game, Elden Ring: Nightreign - and great the lamentation from certain quarters when it was revealed to be a co-op-focussed experience. If you missed the reveal, perhaps because you value sleep over the spectacle of Geoff Keighley's fashion friends, let me catch you up: in Nightreign, you pick one of eight preset characters and explore a parallel-universe version of Elden Ring's Limgrave map, fighting lesser foes and levelling up quickly so that you can battle a boss at the end of each 15-minute in-game day. 
 
Read more
articles.title: Elden Ring: Nightreign will support singleplayer, but it might not reward it

articles.author: RPS
articles.description:
Uh, it's probably not a problem - probably - but I'm seeing a small discrepancy in today's advent calendar and... no, never mind... it's well within acceptable bounds. Go ahead, open the door.

 
Read more
articles.title: The RPS Advent Calendar 2024, December 17th

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
Quick, the world is in peril, your adopted daughter is under threat, and nearby villagers are being terrorised by monsters. What do you do? Oh, you're sitting down at a cosy table in the local tavern. You're playing a card game with a dude called "Aldert". The wind outside is howling, and so are the nightwraiths, but you're just sitting there. Playing another "cow" card. Okay.
Guess you'll be happy to learn that the Witcher 4 developers have more or less confirmed that Gwent will be making a return in the recently trailered Ciri-led sequel. 
Read more
articles.title: Gwent returns in The Witcher 4, according to CD Projekt's heavy hints

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
Sometimes dogs are hard to shut up. Over a year and half after releasing Hrot from early access, the developer of the Quake-inspired shooter has fixed the dogs after discovering that a few of the canines have been, for some players, barking in a hideous and endless loop. 
Read more
articles.title: Boomer shooter dev discovers his dogs have been barking on an "unbearable" loop for years

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
At 9 years old, in the plastic seats of a Sega Rally arcade machine, I quickly learned that "automatic" is better than "manual" without understanding why. And now I know: changing gears is a fucking chore. This year, in my mid-thirties, I finally learned to drive. And weirdly, a racing game about destroying clapped-out old bangers helped me along. Thank you Wreckfest, for all the bottled road rage you allowed me to unleash.
Read more
articles.title: Playing Wreckfest while learning to drive was surprisingly helpful

articles.author: RPS
articles.description:
Today’s door has a big DO NOT ENTER sign, suggesting your immediate opening of it was in fact prohibited. Banned. Taboo, even. Yet it’s hard to see why, as it swings open to reveal a spectacular sunset view, interrupted only by the roar of a mechanical woolly mammoth.

 
Read more
articles.title: The RPS Advent Calendar 2024, December 16th

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Seasons greetings, reader! It's almost time to hang your stocking by the crackling fireplace and post your handwritten letters to Santa up the chimney. If you don't have stockings, a fireplace, or a pen, rest easy. I've had a word with Santa's elves, and they say it's permissible to hang a trash bag by your George Foreman grill or local equivalent, and leave a comment on an RPS article instead. Wot you want for Wintermas, then? Extra trash bags? New George Foreman grill? Whatever it is, Santa will provide. If he doesn't, I'll feed him to the Maw.
 Read more
articles.title: The Maw: what's new in PC games this week?

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Can one sleep on a bookshelf? I'm going to find out. See you in the new year. Or, probably next Sunday with another minimum effort column entry. Book for now! 
 Read more
articles.title: What's on your bookshelf?: I am going to sleep for several weeks edition

articles.author: RPS
articles.description:
Today’s advent calendar window is a window upon Xmas past. It returns us to the days of LAN parties and dial-up, of demo discs and Fileplanet – a more innocent era, before multiplayer shooters fell under the spell of progression. Not that innocent, maybe. There were plenty of arseholes back then. Some of them now run very large software companies. But at least there was no grinding to ruin your bunnyhopping.
Read more
articles.title: The RPS Advent Calendar 2024, December 15th

articles.author: RPS
articles.description:
Squeezing through the advent calendar window into a sodden glade of flower and coral, you spy a curious organism on a ledge in the shadows. It’s a video game of some description, though it looks like a squirrel, with frantic white eyes. What’s it doing? Ah, whoops, you’ve startled it. Better follow it offscreen.

 
Read more
articles.title: The RPS Advent Calendar 2024, December 14th

articles.author: Ollie Toms
articles.description:
Most of the population of the RPS treehouse is currently hanging limply off various branches after the ordeal that was "staying up until 6am to cover everything announced at The Game Awards. So let's keep this brief, and no one speak too loudly please, we're sensitive at the moment. Here's what we're all playing this weekend!
 Read more
articles.title: What are we all playing this weekend?

articles.author: Ed Thorn
articles.description:
Crimson Desert first galloped onto the scene in 2020, with a bombastic trailer at Gamescom 2023 showcasing some particularly beautiful medieval open world action adventuring. It's got horses, fishing, plate armour and roving heroism, but one thing it lacks is a release date. Now, thanks to The Geoff Awards, that's changed! Well, sort of - Crimson Desert is out sometime in late 2025.
Read more
articles.title: Open world sword-swinger Crimson Desert horse-powerslides to a late 2025 release

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
Stealth launching a game during an awards ceremony is cool. But you know what's cooler? Stealth launching a union. As many in the games industry settled in for an evening of advertisements and blockbuster backslapping, one group of US workers quietly succeeded in organising something of their own. Employees at Zenimax Online Studios launched their union with 461 members, as announced on social media site Bluesky last night. 
Read more
articles.title: While CEOs got dressed up for the Game Awards, 461 workers at Zenimax Online Studios unionised

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
Will the bulletting of my beloved dinosaurs never cease? Turok: Origins will revisit the dino-hunting archery of ye olde Nintendo 64, reimagining it as a story of three native huntsfolk out to lambast large lizards. The big new angle is that it'll be a third-person shooter and you can play in online co-op as a team of T-rex wreckers. You then slurp up their dino DNA to upgrade your character. Come and watch these crimes against nature in the trailer below.
Read more
articles.title: Turok: Origins will revisit the dinosaur hunter in a third-person shooter with co-op

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
Earlier this week we heard rumblings of a new character announcement for Tekken 8, and at the same time a trailer dropped a big unmistakable hint for red-dressed rabble rouser Anna Williams. Turns out that unmistakable hint was mistakable. My mistake. At last night's Game Awards we learned that the next fighter to come to the game will be... Clive? From Final Fantasy XVI? Sure. Why not.
Read more
articles.title: Tekken 8's next fighter is Clive, actually

articles.author: RPS
articles.description:
Would you like to know more? Open the door and earn your citizenship today.

 
Read more
articles.title: The RPS Advent Calendar 2024, December 13th

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Capcom are working on a sequel to Okami, the wonderful 2006 Zelda-like in which you play a sun goddess in a wolf's body, roaming a world of ink and parchment. It’s being co-developed by M-TWO Inc, Machine Head Works Inc and CLOVERS Inc, and directed by original Okami game director Hideki Kamiya. I am tickled pink, I tell you. Find a trailer below.
 
Read more
articles.title: We're getting an Okami 2, with Hideki Kamiya at the reins

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Naughty Dog have announced their long-gestating new game, and their first in a long while that's not a sequel. Intergalactic: The Heretic Prophet is a science fiction bounty hunter game set on a mysterious isolated planet, and the first cinematic trailer is below.

 
Read more
articles.title: Naughty Dog are making a sci-fi bounty hunter game called Intergalactic: The Heretic Prophet

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Zdeněk Biberle)
articles.description: Minule jsme si ukázali, jak nebezpečné může být tvořit strukturovaná data konkatenací řetězců. Může dojít až ke zneužití tohoto kódu útočníkem. Dnes se podíváme na to, jak nahradit tento postup robustnější technikou.
articles.title: Manipulace se strukturovanými daty: sémantická manipulace s JSON dokumenty

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jiří Sluka)
articles.description: Pravidelná sonda do světa software. Podíváme se na nástroj pro odběr obsahu přes RSS a Atom, budeme číst e-knihy a nakonec si vyzkoušíme přehrávání hudby na více zvukových zařízeních současně.
articles.title: Softwarová sklizeň (8. 1. 2025): pohodlné čtení elektronických knih

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: Seznámíme se s dvěma technologiemi, které byly součástí mikroprocesoru Intel 80386. Tento v několika ohledech přelomový čip totiž kromě dalších vylepšení nabízel možnost stránkování (paging) a nový virtuální režim.
articles.title: Nové vlastnosti čipů 80386: stránkování a virtuální režim 8086

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Filip Zatloukal)
articles.description: První betaverze OpenMoHAA, otevřené reimplementace Medal of Honor: Allied Assault včetně rozšíření Spearhead a Breakthrough. Tým emulátoru herní konzole PlayStation 3 RPCS3 oznámil vydání pro architekturu arm64.
articles.title: OpenMoHAA je otevřený Medal of Honor, emulátor RPCS3 vyšel na arm64

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Monika Kutějová)
articles.description: Podíváme se na kampaň čínského Flax Typhoon proti americkým cílům, exploit s označením LDAPNightmare, přechod Microsoftu ze starých .NET domén nebo kompromitace desítek rozšíření prohlížeče Chrome.
articles.title: Postřehy z bezpečnosti: LDAPNightmare a útok na rozšíření v Chromu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Filip Zatloukal)
articles.description: AROS, operační systém kompatibilní s AmigaOS míří k 64bitové verzi. Projekt Debian vydal první alfa verzi instalátoru chystaného Debianu Trixie. Vývojový tým, který stojí za systémem Nobara Linux, oficiálně představil Nobara 41.
articles.title: Malá 3D tiskárna Lemontron, 64bitový AROS a první alfa Debianu 13

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Zvažované převzetí vývoje Compute Runtime pro stará CPU Intel, 32 patchů sjednocuje kód RadeonSI OpenGL a RADV Vulkan, ZLUDA v4 jako experimentální implementace CUDA pro ne-Nvidia GPU, LibreOffice 25.2 RC1 k dispozici.
articles.title: KDE Plasma 6.3 s lepší podporou tabletů, ZLUDA v4 zatím jen pro Geekbench

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Na konci roku 2024 se odehrálo tradiční setkání hackerských komunit v Hamburku. Akce pro tisíce účastníků byla vyprodaná během několika minut. Podívejte se, jak to vypadá na největší hackerské akci v Evropě.
articles.title: Kongres 38C3: největší setkání hackerů v německém Hamburku

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Linuxový desktop poskytuje úžasné možnosti a je každým rokem lepší a lepší. Je však řada oblastí, kde kardinálně zaostává, nezřídka i o desítky let za komerčními produkty. Kolik věcí stihne v roce 2025, je otázkou.
articles.title: Co by mohl potřebovat linuxový desktop v roce 2025

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: Budeme se zabývat zarovnáním údajů v datových strukturách uložených v binární podobě (alignment) a taktéž tím, jak jsou realizovány výplně (padding) přidávané na konec serializovaných datových struktur.
articles.title: Manipulace s binárními datovými strukturami v Pythonu (2. část)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Arch Linux User Repository, tedy AUR, striktně vyžaduje, aby balíčky byly vždy dostupné i pro platformu x86_64. Software, který je pouze pro 64bit ARM, se do AUR nedostane. Toto nynější zjištění / platné nastavení vychází ze skutečnosti, že Arch Linux oficiálně podporuje platformu x86_64, zatímco pro ARM je „jen“ neoficiálně portován, podobně jako třeba pro 32bit x86.
articles.title: AUR repozitář Arch Linuxu vyžaduje, aby balíčky byly i pro x86_64

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Nový open-source projekt HipScript má jednoduchý cíl: nabídnou běh kódu napsaného v Nvidia CUDA či AMD HIP rovnou ve webovém prohlížeči. Využívá přitom WebAssembly a WebGPU. Už nyní je schopen rozběhat základní kernely s plnou podporou C++, statickou i dynamickou paměti a velmi základní podporou možností rozhraní CUDA a HIP.
articles.title: HipScript zprovozní Nvidia CUDA i AMD HIP přímo ve webovém prohlížeči

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Společnost Dell oznámila, že už nebude vyrábět ultrabooky v oblíbené řadě XPS. Rovněž ruší své značky Latitude, Inspiron a Precision. Počítače Dell budou mít v budoucnu pouze značku Dell, která je v dnešním oznámení společnosti Dell popsána jako „určená pro zábavu, školu a práci“.
articles.title: Dell končí s řadami XPS, Latitude, Inspiron a Precision

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Viklicka)
articles.description: Valné shromáždění OSN přijalo bez hlasování na Štědrý den Smlouvu o boji proti kyberkriminalitě, kterou se například Electronic Frontier Foundation již několik let zabývá a detailně popisuje problémy z toho vyplývající.
articles.title: OSN přijala Smlouvu o boji proti kyberkriminalitě

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Od pátku 10. ledna 2025 přejde certifikační autorita DigiCert na novou síť CDN (Content Delivery Network) a přidělí nové vyhrazené IPv4 adresy několika službám pro protokol OCSP (Online Certificate Status Protocol), seznam odvolaných certifikátů (CRL) a několik dalších služeb DigiCert. V této době také autorita zruší podporu pro IPv6.
articles.title: DigiCert mění CDN a vypíná podporu IPv6

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Společnost Lenovo na veletrhu CES v Las Vegas mimo jiné představila také přenosnou herní konzoli Legion Go S, která je oficiálně licencovaná společností Valve pro systém SteamOS. K dispozici je ve dvou verzích: bílá varianta přichází s předinstalovaným systémem Windows, černá používá systém SteamOS – stejně jako Steam Deck přímo od Valve.
articles.title: Lenovo představilo přenosnou herní konzoli Legion Go S se systémem SteamOS

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: O Bitcoinu je slyšet čím dál víc. Kupují ho velké instituce jako je BlackRock a v Salvadoru je dokonce zákonným platidlem. Přijďte si na naše nové školení poslechnout, jak Bitcoin funguje, proč byste se o něj měli zajímat a kde si ho pořídit.
articles.title: Zajímá vás Bitcoin? Přijďte se o něm dozvědět víc na školení

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Ovladač softwarového renderingu Lavapipe používaný v situaci, kdy dané rozhraní nemá hardwarovou podporu na straně GPU (například právě Vulkan u super-starých grafických karet) aktuálně dostal podporu tvářit se jako vyhovující specifikaci Vulkan 1.4.
articles.title: Ovladač Lavapipe nyní udává podporu Vulkan 1.4

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Nová verze Firefoxu nepřináší téměř nic nového. Na Linuxu nabízí vylepšenou podporu gest pro touchpad, kdy lze využívat kinetické scrollování s přerušením pomocí položení dvou prstů na touchpad. Na platformě Windows pak Firefox podporuje hardwarovou akceleraci videí ve formátu H.265, je-li tato k dispozici. V textových polích (vyjma hesel/emailů/URL) lze využívat HTML atribut pro automatické opravy textu.
articles.title: Vyšel Firefox 134 s vylepšenou podporou gest pro touchpad

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: johny)
articles.description: Portál The Verge včera upozornil na ďalší z trikov z dielne Microsoftu. Ak sa neprihlásený používateľ prehliadača Edge pokúsi zadať do lokátora Google, vyskočí mu okno, ktoré sa navonok podobá na UI Googlu, ale ide v skutočnosti o zamaskovaný Bing.
articles.title: Bing chce získať nových používateľov pomocou triku, napodobňuje vzhľad Google

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Vilém Sládek)
articles.description: Už za 14 dní se uskuteční další setkání komunity nejen českých a slovenských správců internetových sítí - CSNOG 2025. Tuto akci komunity CSNOG (Czech and Slovak Network Operators Group) organizují již po osmé zástupci sdružení CESNET, CZ.NIC a NIX.CZ a i letos se bude konat na půdě Univerzity Tomáše Bati ve Zlíně.
articles.title: Síťařské setkání CSNOG 2025 bude už za 14 dní, registrujte se včas

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Nvidia představila novou generaci svých GPU Blackwell. Nadále jde o obří čipy vyráběné pokročilým procesem u TSMC, přičemž komu se zdála cena za například GeForce RTX 4090 nemravná, bude na první uvedenou GeForce RTX 5080 potřebovat zhruba stejné peníze a chystaná GeForce RTX 5090 bude ještě daleko dražší.
articles.title: Nvidia představila Blackwell, GeForce RTX 5000 s dvojnásobným výkonem a výrazně vyšší cenou

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Mike John zveřejnil video ze své cesty autonomním taxi Waymo na letiště Scottsdale (Arizona). Auto z neznámých důvodů nechtělo na parkovišti zastavit a stále jezdilo v kruzích. Pasažér nemá možnost z jedoucího auta vystoupit.
articles.title: Autonomní taxi Waymo jezdilo se zákazníkem v kruzích

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Proxmox je moderní virtualizační platforma, která v mnoha případech může nahradit VMware. Je open-source, zdarma a je postaven na otevřených technologiích jako KVM, LXC, CEPH a dalších. Pokud potřebujete provozovat virtualizaci, Proxmox je pro vás ideální stack a na našem workshopu Proxmox se dozvíte, jak na něj.
articles.title: Proxmox: moderní virtualizační platforma schopná nahradit VMware (školení)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Raspberry Pi 5 se prodává s 2, 4, a 8 GB RAM. Uživatel Sascha0815 si však všiml PCB, která je zřejmě již připravená na 16 GB RAM. Dočkáme se tedy 16 GB RAM v Raspberry Pi 5 již brzy?
articles.title: Raspberry Pi 5 s 16 GB RAM již brzy?

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Free Software Foundation (FSF) nabádá uživatele, aby tlačili na Microsoft kvůli požadavku TPM 2.0 pro Windows 11. Minulý rok v prosinci Microsoft uvedl, že požadavek na TPM 2.0 ve Windows 11 nepůjde obejít. A k tomu podpora Windows 10 skončí již letos 14. října.
articles.title: FSF nabádá uživatele, aby tlačili na Microsoft kvůli požadavku TPM 2.0 pro Windows 11

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Siri je virtuální pomocník v mobilních zařízeních Apple. Aktivuje se pouze povelem „Hey, Siri“. Ale ukázalo se, že Siri naslouchá i jindy. Výsledek byl ten, že jste dostávali přesně mířenou reklamu odpovídající například značce, o které jste zrovna hovořili.
articles.title: Apple zaplatí 95 miliónů dolarů za to, že Siri „neúmyslně“ poslouchala soukromé konverzace

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Nginx je dnes přibližně na třetině web serverů na internetu a toto číslo stále roste. Je výkonný, spolehlivý, má spoustu funkcí a dobře se spravuje. Pokud potřebujete dobrý web server pro svůj projekt, bude Nginx správnou volbou.
articles.title: Nasaďte moderní web server s Nginx (školení)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Nedávno jsme psali o začlenění programovacího jazyka COBOL do kompilátoru GCC. Hned na Nový rok Jose Marchesi z Oracle poslal do GCC podporu jazyka ALGOL 68. Jde zatím o work-in-progress.
articles.title: ALGOL 68 v GCC

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Na serveru GOG.com lze zdarma získat hru Vambrace: Cold Soul. Jde o fantasy RPG adveturu.
articles.title: Hra na GOG.com zdarma Vambrace: Cold Soul

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Orbit od Mozilly je nový asistent používající umělou inteligenci, který je určen pro webový prohlížeč Firefox. V jednom tlačítku nabízí snadné shrnutí obsahu e-mailů, dokumentů, článků a videí na webu. Mozilla tvrdí, že hlavní výhodou je, že asistent nezasahuje do soukromí uživatelů.
articles.title: Mozilla představila vlastního AI asistenta jménem Orbit

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: V rámci příprav na vydání stabilní verze Debianu 13 Trixie v průběhu letošního roku vyšla první alfa verze instalátoru Debianu pro Trixie. Jde o první vydání v rámci vývojového cyklu Trixie a poprvé je součástí také podpora 64bitové architektury RISC-V.
articles.title: Debian Installer Trixie Alpha 1 přináší podporu RISC-V a ruší i386

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Nová verze 47 distribuce 4MLinux byl před pár dny prohlášena za stabilní. Tvůrci přecházejí z jádra řady 6.1 na novější 6.6 a k tomu přidávají obligátní várku aktualizací. Vyzdvihují například LibreOffice 24.8 a GNOME Office (AbiWord 3.0.5, GIMP 2.10.38, Gnumeric 1.12.57), prohlížeče Firefox 133 a Chrome 131, plus pošťáka Thunderbird 128.5.
articles.title: 4MLinux 47.0 s jádrem LTS verze 6.6 a beta verze 48.0

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Hudební přehrávač Amarok s novou verzí 3.2 s kódovým označením „Punkadiddle“ přináší několik oprav a vylepšení, ale hlavně také náhled na běh přes Qt6 / KDE Frameworks 6. Program odteď disponuje možností sestavit z jeho kód jak verzi pro Qt5, tak Qt6, ač nadále platí, že doporučeno je držet se osvědčeného Qt5, dokud nebude podpora Qt6 plně odladěna (v tuto chvíli se ví o řadě problémů, které ještě nejsou vyřešeny).
articles.title: Amarok 3.2 „Punkadiddle“ nabízí běh s Qt6/KF6

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Uživatelé starších Radeonů v posledních letech mohli sledovat práce Valve (a AMD) na kompilátoru ACO, který je „optimalizovanější“ variací na použití standardního LLVM. Už před téměř pěti lety jsme psali o testech ukazujících sympatický nárůst výkonu starších Radeonů, nyní je ACO výchozím kompilátorem v rámci Mesa, a to pro Radeony generací starších než RDNA (např. Radeon RX 5700).
articles.title: RadeonSI dostává ACO jako výchozí kompilátor pro starší Radeony

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Malé modely AI mají být velkým trendem. Infrastruktura pro rok 2025: Gartner předpovídá devirtualizaci a distribuovaná úložiště. Předvedli kvantovou teleportaci v infrastruktuře běžného internetového provozu. Nový zákon o kybernetické bezpečnosti může dopadnout i na firmy s méně než 10 zaměstnanci.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Malé modely AI mají být velkým trendem

Olomoucký grafenový materiál míří na trh díky spin-out společnosti. Studie fotonů odhalila, že při jejich srážce se mohou objevit víry – a jak to souvisí s kvantovými počítači?

Trendy pro rok 2025: Co čekat od automatizace a využití IT?Soukromý cloud versus on-premise systémy. Konference Fortinet Security Day 2024 představila nejmodernější technologie k řešení kyberbezpečnostních výzev. Nedostatečné zabezpečení koncových zařízení ohrožuje firmy.

articles.author: Elliott Gatica
articles.description:
If you’re grinding through Warframe 1999 bounties and came across the “Destroy Scaldra Efervon Containers” bounty, we can tell you how or where to find them. 


These things can be elusive as much as they can be hidden in plain sight, so don’t fret.


Where to find Scaldra Efervon containers in Warframe


Easily enough, Efervon containers can be found on the street level of the Hollvania areas. As the name also suggests, you can mostly find these when fighting against the Scaldra faction.


The Scaldra faction is the one with the humanoid enemies who oftentimes have toxic-imbued weapons and people with orange suits. They are fought almost primarily on street-level areas. Every now and then, some may spill over into the underground area where the Techrot reside.


However, for the case of f…
articles.title: Where to find Scaldra Efervon containers in Warframe

articles.author: Julián F.L.
articles.description:
Tango Gameworks, the legendary studio behind beloved games like The Evil Within and Hi-Fi Rush, got a fresh new start when Krafton acquired it shortly after Microsoft closed it down last year. Fortunately for its fans, the studio just confirmed that it established its new offices in Tokyo, Japan.


According to 4Gamer, Tango Gameworks resumed its operations in its new Tokyo offices on January 1, where they began working under Krafton. The studio confirmed that it will "inherit the unique color and development philosophy of Tango Gameworks and aim for further development", which means that the developers will try to keep doing what they know best and make creative and unique games like they used to do under ZeniMax and Microsoft.


Image via Tango Gameworks/Steam


While Shinji Mikami, one …
articles.title: Tango Gameworks resumes operations in its new Tokyo offices, and is already looking for new recruits

articles.author: Filip Galekovic
articles.description:
If you've been playing Assassin's Creed from day one onwards, you may recall just how enamored the community was with its parkour systems. These developed rather nicely up until Unity, only for subsequent RPG-like releases to downplay parkour as a whole. That's all changing in Assassin's Creed: Shadows, happily enough.


As someone who fell off the AC ride around the time of Unity's release, the fact that the franchise would de-emphasize arguably its most important gameplay system to the degree of Origins and Odyssey caught me off-guard. Ubisoft does appear to agree to some extent, because Assassin's Creed Shadows is adding complexity and manual movement control back into the mix. Ubisoft has recently published a blog discussing Shadows' parkour systems in great depth, and boy howdy will l…
articles.title: Assassin’s Creed Shadows’ parkour system is what we’ve been waiting for since the first game

articles.author: Joseph Luster
articles.description:
Following up on the first round in October 2024, Capcom is getting ready for another Monster Hunter Wilds open beta test. This one officially kicks off on February 6 with content from the first test and a new hunting opportunity.


The meat of the new content is the ability to hunt Gypceros, a returning monster from the series. Features from the first test include Character Creation, Story Trial, and the Slay Doshaguma Quest. If you already made a character in the first test, fear not, because that data can be carried over to the second. It can also be carried over to the full game when it launches, but that doesn't apply to game progress.


Watch as producer Ryozo Tsujimoto announces the test and schedule with his own eerily accurate custom character below.




There are two sessions planned, and you don't have to be subscribed to PlayStation Plus or Game Pass Core/Ultimate to try it out. Here's when you'll be able to play, complete with crossplay between the three platforms:


Monster Hunter Wilds open beta 2 schedule 



Starts: Thursday, February 6, 2025 at 7:00 p.m. PT


Ends: Sunday, February 9, 2025 at 6:59 p.m. PT




Starts: Thursday, February 13, 2025 at 7:00 p.m. PT


Ends:  Sunday, February 16, 2025 at 6:59 p.m. PT



There are also special bonuses in store for everyone who participates in the beta test. A decorative charm for your weapon or Seikret, as well as an item pack, can all be redeemed in the full game. 


According to Tsujimoto, they heard from a lot of players who either missed out on the first test or just want to play again. That prompted the planning for the upcoming test. He added that the team is still hard at work finishing the game, with adjustments and improvements underway that won't make it into the second beta in time. We'll see how those improvements stack up when Monster Hunter Wilds launches on PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X|S, and PC via Steam on February 28.

The post Monster Hunter Wilds kicks off second open beta test on February 6 appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Monster Hunter Wilds kicks off second open beta test on February 6

While Steam Deck has been a lot of people's go-to when it comes to handheld PC gaming, the likes of Lenovo have been making their own mark on the industry. The Legion Go has offered a decent alternative to Valve's portable system, but we're about to experience a first.


Lenovo is all set to launch the Legion Go S. Announced at CES 2025, the upcoming device will be more ergonomic and feature a smaller screen when compared to the current model. According to a post on Micro Center, a Windows 11 version will be launching sometime in January, and will have an RRP of $729.




However, if you're willing to wait a bit longer, there's an alternative model, which will come with SteamOS, the very same software that powers the Steam Deck UX. This version is expected to be released sometime in May.

articles.author: Filip Galekovic
articles.description:
If there was any doubt as to whether Nvidia was all-in on the generative AI hype train, now's the time to dispel those notions. The announcement of RTX 5000 GPUs has been followed by a glut of other related information, including Nvidia ACE: a new kind of AI-driven NPC.


To clarify right off the bat, AI has, over the past couple of years, become a universal moniker for advanced language models in the real world. These things aren't really any sort of artificial intelligence, but calling them AI sure is neat and simple, so companies leverage that for marketing hype. Nvidia ACE, however, kind-of-sort-of fits into the classic definition of AI due to it driving in-game NPCs using small, localized language models. That's right: Nvidia is now looking to improve video game AI using boring real-w…
articles.title: Boring real-world AI is apparently helping improve video game AI through Nvidia ACE

articles.description:
Act Three of Episode: Revenant has come to Destiny 2, and its main attraction is the new Kell's Fall Exotic mission. Guardians are tasked with forging deep into the Revenant lair of Fikrul to root out his corrupting influence and investigate the Echo he wields. However, the Exotic mission is not just a simple run through a haunted house; players will have to venture into the enemy stronghold multiple times if they want to conquer the fel Kell.


Kell's Fall serves as the main centerpiece of Act Three, meaning players must repeatedly venture into the Exotic mission as the narrative unfolds. While Guardians aren't prevented from joining a friend to attempt Kell's Fall if they're not caught up on the story, players cannot select the activity independently unless they've already completed Act …

If you have loved Fisch in Roblox, Dig It could be equally enjoyable for you. In this case, there's no Fishing Rod; instead, you have to use your Shovel to dig up the riches buried in the ground.


But every game requires an active community, and you can get help from the game's official Discord and Trello accounts. The Trello is immensely useful if you're looking to learn the basic and advanced concepts of the game. The Discord server, on the other hand, is a great place if you're looking for a community.


How to use the Dig It Discord server

The three Gauntlet missions V are part of the Heist package which was one of the new feature that GTA V brought to the franchise. Procuring cars is definitely a big part of the Heist missions and, indeed, finding these three particular vehicles is an essential part of completing the Gold Heist.

The sneak peeks until now have been exclusive to the game's official Discord server, and the upcoming update could be a huge set of content releases. It will have something for beginners and veterans alike, including a new boss themed around the festive season.

In this guide, we'll tell you which Shovels you should focus on getting from the moment you just start playing all the way to the late game.


How progression works in Dig It


In Dig It, your Shovel is your progression. The better your Shovel, the more you are worth as a junkrat or digger, if you prefer. On each island, you have a number of Shovels. Each of these costs a set amount of money and needs a specific level. 


Before you ask, NO, you really don't need to buy every Shovel in the game. You essentially need to get just four of them (five if you count the tutorial one), after which you can usually move to the next island.

articles.author: Arka Sarkar
articles.description:
Season 4 is going to be the first major set of events in NBA 2K25, and you'll be able to win plenty of rewards for your MyCareer and MyTeam experiences soon enough.


Seasons are the best way to win new rewards inside the game, most of it is available for free. Publishers 2K has already confirmed the release date of the new season as part of the latest game update. The date is also indicated by the ongoing Season 3 Pass and only a few more hours are left for you to complete it to get all the available rewards.


NBA 2K25 Season 4 release date


The official patch notes for update 4.0 confirmed the release date, and the new season will kick off on January 10. You'll be able to unlock a fresh set of rewards come Friday, and it could include some truly cracked items for you to enjoy. Season 4 will begin at 8 a.m. PT/11 a.m. ET, which is the standard for all prior seasons.


This also means that you have little over two days, as of writing, to complete Season 3 pass. Chances are that you might have already unlocked all 40 levels of freebies, but if you haven't, now is the perfect time. Season 4's reward track will replace the Season 3 pass once we are past 8 a.m. PT on January 10.


NBA 2K25 Season 4 rewards




As of writing, we don't have any hints or official news about the rewards, apart from Gilgeous-Alexander being the icon superstar for the new season. However, new information will be appearing later today, January 8, and we will update this piece accordingly. It's safe to assume that the Season pass won't undergo any major changes.


In simpler words, there will be 40 levels of rewards for you to unlock. A total of 80 different items are going to be available, equally split between MyCareer and MyTeam modes. If you decide to purchase the paid upgrade, you'll be able to unlock 40 additional rewards for your grind. There are chances that Season 4's Pass could feature a 99-rated player item for the first time.

The post NBA 2K25 Season 4 release date, rewards, and more appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: NBA 2K25 Season 4 release date, rewards, and more

articles.author: Zoey Handley
articles.description:
I technically never stopped playing retro games. When I had my Gamecube, I was still playing games on my SNES. However, around that time, I also bought an NES. The games I got with it – games like Total Recall and Kid Icarus – had me convinced that I just hated games on the NES. It wasn’t until I was introduced to a couple of games on this list, that retro gaming truly opened up to me.


I do believe that games age, but mostly on a technical level. Poor framerates and blurry graphics can make it difficult to return to an early 3D game. Their design, on the other hand, is rarely completely superseded. Video game development really just goes through trends. Right now, there’s a particular style of game that is favored by gamers, but this was different 10 years ago, which was different 10 yea…

Of all the additions added in Wuthering Waves 2.0, the Flight tool is likely the most impactful regarding exploration. Normally, you cannot use Flight if you're too close to the ground, but there are two handy little tricks that will allow you to always circumvent this limitation.


How to fly from anywhere in Wuthering Waves

If you’ve got a PlayStation 5 but you’re itching for the nostalgia brought by previous generation games, don’t worry; there’s a way that you can scratch that nostalgic itch without having to go out and buy a second-hand console or pull yours out of storage.

Less than a year after entering Early Access Alpha, developer Titan Forge Games and Hi-Rez Studios have announced that the sequel to the popular third-person MOBA, Smite 2, will be entering its free-to-play Open Beta on January 14.




It's been a productive Alpha for Smite 2 which in that time has grown its arsenal of playable gods from 14 to an impressive 45. The number of game modes in the MOBA has also grown from just one to six, with a new mode called Joust launching alongside the Open Beta release.


During the Alpha, Smite 2 has also received a plethora of improvements and enhancements to the core game to really flesh out what Titan Forge Games and Hi-Rez Studios had envisioned for the sequel for the popular MOBA.


With the Open Beta release, all players will be able to download Sm…

For those who prioritize mobility, the SMG class is a must-know. These guns are practically designed for fast-paced gameplay, always keeping you on the move and offering much better handling through their light build. Their agility and quick aim make them a favorite among players who value speed and precision.


If you want a taste of what the submachine class offers, we're here to show you the best SMGs and their loadouts in Black Ops 6.


What are the best SMGs and loadouts in BO6?

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
In the wake of Russia's invasion of Ukraine, the EU banned a number of Russian news outlets from broadcasting to any member state, including via websites and IPTV. Following a recent move by Lithuania, Google has reportedly deindexed over 200 websites offering EU-sanctioned content. The list includes the websites of specific broadcasters but also many portals offering pirated movies, TV shows, and unlicensed live TV streams, including some from Ukraine.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Google Deindexes 200 Streaming Sites For Violating EU Sanctions on Russia

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
In the live sports broadcasting arena, dynamic blocking of pirate IPTV streams is seen as increasingly useful to tackle a prevalent and highly resilient form of illicit content delivery. Yet as the highly-publicized blunders of 2024 showed, getting blocking wrong benefits nobody. To that background, a blocking specialist at anti-piracy company Friend MTS is encouraging restraint.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: IPTV Piracy Expert Urges Restraint in Rush Towards Automated Blocking

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Italy's 'Piracy Shield' blocking system was originally invented to protect time-sensitive live sports streams from pirates. A year later, rightsholders are pushing for an update to cover a wider range of content, including films. This move, which is expected to be discussed in a forthcoming consultation, aims to gradually expand the 'next-gen' blocking system.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Anti-Piracy Group Wants to Expand Italy’s ‘Piracy Shield’ to Protect Movies

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Every week we take a close look at the most pirated movies on torrent sites. What are pirates downloading? 'Wicked' tops the chart, followed by 'Mufasa: The Lion King'. 'Gladiator II' completes the top three.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Top 10 Most Pirated Movies of The Week – 01/06/2025

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
York Crown Court has sentenced a man from Halifax to two years in prison for selling 'pirate' IPTV subscriptions loaded on Fire Sticks. Rightsholders and authorities hope that the criminal prosecution of the 41-year-old (re)seller, who served a few hundred customers, will send a deterrent message. However, the big fish in this hugely profitable industry remain unscathed. 
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: UK Court Sentences ‘Pirate’ Fire Stick Seller to Two Years in Prison

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
Many sites have laid claim to the title of most popular pirate site but traffic data being reported by SimilarWeb for streaming site HiAnime.to is on a whole new level. After pulling in 302 million visits in September, the pirate streaming site added almost 62 million more in October. That earns the platform a GlobalRank of 120, and a U.S. streaming sector rank higher than Disney Plus.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: HiAnime Outranks DisneyPlus in the U.S. With a Record 364m Monthly Visits

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
In a continued effort to combat online piracy, Japanese publishing giant Shueisha has requested a DMCA subpoena to compel X to expose two 'pirate accounts'. This is the latest move to identify the operators of major manga pirate portals through U.S. federal courts. If the operators of Spoilerplus and Mangaraw are identified, they could potentially be sued in Japan.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Manga Publisher Shueisha Wants X to Expose ‘One Piece’ Pirates

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
In 2022, a group of Israel-based TV companies obtained a court order in the U.S. It compelled every ISP in the country to block three resilient pirate sites that blocking in Israel had failed to stop. Intervention by Cloudflare ended that dream and 2.5 years later, despite other measures targeting the sites, it appears that at least one is still going strong. The TV companies are now taking legal action against UK ISPs; they're unlikely to put up a fight, they may not even turn up in court.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: TV Group Couldn’t Force U.S. ISPs to Block Pirates, UK ISPs May Offer Help

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
Italy launched its ambitious "Piracy Shield" platform in early 2024, hoping to finally curb the rampant piracy of live sports events. Throughout the year, the system has primarily targeted the domains and IP addresses used by pirate IPTV providers to stream illegal content. Official data made available to the public is limited but with help from data provided by an anonymous source, we can identify key trends from a very controversial year.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Piracy Shield: Top 10 Countries Blocked For Hosting IPTV Pirates in 2024

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Anti-piracy coalition ACE wraps up a transformative and successful year. Despite major shifts in leadership, the MPA-backed coalition of media companies secured key victories, including the high-profile takedown of the Fmovies piracy network.  ACE also reported a number of other successes and has already set its sights on new 'pirate' targets for the coming year.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: ACE Wraps Up Transformative Year with a Fresh List of Pirate Site Targets

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Link-Busters is the unofficial DMCA takedown champion of 2024. The anti-piracy outfit works for many of the world's largest publishing companies and is currently flagging the majority of all 'pirate' URLs to Google search; more than two billion in total. Despite this stellar effort, book pirates are chalking up new records too. 
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: More Than Half of All Google Search Takedowns Now Come from Link-Busters

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
For the past several years, the recording industry has branded stream-ripping services the leading piracy threat. On the near horizon, the industry claims that the rise of generative AI presents a new and rapidly evolving challenge for the music ecosystem that threatens its long-term sustainability. According to global industry group IFPI, stream-ripping is likely fueling this secondary threat.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: IFPI: Stream-Ripping Fuels Generative AI From Which Existential Threats Emerge

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
The final verdict in a Danish site blocking battle, involving LaLiga and Rojadirecta, confirms that live sports broadcasts are protected copyright works. This marks a significant victory for rightsholders, who believe that this landmark decision paves the way for increased blocking of pirate streaming services across Europe. 
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Danish Court Greenlights Copyright Protection for Live Sports in Landmark Blocking Case

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
According to a phrase popularized by Carl Sagan, extraordinary claims should be supported by extraordinary evidence. A new piracy scare story published on Sunday takes a different approach. The extraordinary claim is that fake IPTV portals run by law enforcement are entrapping "ordinary users" to obtain evidence of their crimes. Supported by exactly zero evidence, the report claims that hundreds of internet users have already been identified.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Bogus Pirate IPTV Portals Run By Law Enforcement “Entrap Hundreds”

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
'House of the Dragon' is the most-pirated TV show released on torrent sites in 2024. The popular 'Game of Thrones' prequel replaces 'The Last of Us', which topped the chart last year. Amazon's 'The Boys' takes the second spot at a respectable distance, while Disney's Shōgun is the hottest newcomer.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: ‘House of the Dragon’ Is The Most Pirated TV Show of 2024

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
In a landmark ruling, the Court of Milan has ordered Cloudflare to block pirate streaming services that offer Serie A football matches. The court found that Cloudflare's services are instrumental in facilitating access to live pirate streams, undermining Italy's 'Piracy Shield' legislation. The order, which applies in Italy, affects Cloudflare's CDN, DNS resolver, WARP and proxy services. It also includes a broad data disclosure section. 
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Cloudflare Must Block ‘Piracy Shield’ Domains and IP Addresses Across its Service

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
Around 2016, sports streaming site Rojadirecta closed its doors to visitors from Spain after losing its legal battle with Mediapro. Despite the win, the broadcaster was disappointed that the court had found the company behind Rojadirecta liable, but not company owner Igor Seoane. After the Supreme Court held that Seoane could be held liable, last Friday a court confirmed total damages of $33 million, with Seoane and the company jointly liable for half of that amount.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Rojadirecta & Site Operator Hit With $33m Piracy Damages Judgment

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Once-thriving Usenet provider NSE was targeted by Dutch anti-piracy group BREIN many years ago. Under legal pressure, the provider felt forced to shut down its successful business. Though NSE ultimately triumphed in court, that victory came years later. NSE is now demanding millions of euros to compensate for the alleged damage to its business. BREIN, however, sees things differently. 
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: ‘Destroyed’ Usenet Provider Sues Anti-Piracy Group for Millions in Damages

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Popular shadow library LibGen continues to face trouble. In addition to ongoing technical problems, a U.S. lawsuit resulted in several domain suspensions and seizures in recent weeks. To top it off, the shadow library was just added to Germany's pirate site blocking list, making it harder to access the remaining domains.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Domain Seizures and German ISP Blockade Add to Libgen’s Troubles

articles.description: Ho, ho, ho, Santa is in town. And he’s brought a gift with him. Here’s a shiny new package for you to unwrap, containing the first beta version of the upcoming OpenTTD 15 release. It comes faster, with road waypoints, fewer passwords, better scenario editor, and hopefully with a lot less bugs. To be a bit less vague, here are some of the highlights: Improved picker windows for stations/waypoints/objects/and more. Oh, and that does include road waypoints. Better perfomance in various places, including faster path signals that are now green by default. Password-less network authentication using keys. Several improvements for NewGRFs regarding cargo support. Better scenario editor with a town data importer and manual house placement. A large tree fully hung with ornamental bugfixes. Sadly though, not everbody was good this year. The old NPF pathfinder was finally retired, after YAPF being the superior default for many, many years now. There’s a lot of bugs left for you to find, though, guaranteed. Enjoy the beta, test all the things and report anything you find amiss, to make OpenTTD 15 the best OpenTTD 15 ever. Download Changelog Bug tracker
articles.title: OpenTTD 15.0-beta1

articles.description:
Následuje neupravovaný text zajímavého prohlášení, které vydal můj oblíbenec Varhan Orchestrovič Bauer k nové verzi slovenské hymny:


S úctou a upřímnou pokorou jsem přistoupil k aranžmá národní slovenské hymny "Nad Tatrou sa blýská" již v roce 2016. Hudebně vychází z původní lidové písně a již dávno zažité sestupné basové linky původně inspirované čardášem. V monumentální instrumentaci zaznívá důstojné a bohaté "hradní" Maestoso s výraznou smyčcovou figurací a dramatické Presto s vypjatým protihlasem tak kontrastně jako dunajské nížiny a Vysoké Tatry. Důvodem vzniku bylo hledání krásy a síly slovenské hudby s duchovním nadhledem mně tolik blízké mahlerovské angažovanosti. Velmi důležitá při tom pro mě byla noblesa a hudební kultivovanost při zachování původní písně. Nový rozměr je u mě h…
articles.title: Prohlášení k nové verzi slovenské hymny

articles.author: noreply@blogger.com (Unknown)
articles.description: Jarcovjáková je zajímavá postava (byť postava, se kterou bych nikdy v životě nechtěl osobně komunikovat), její fotografie stojí za povšimnutí a způsob zpracování tohoto dokumentu je téměř geniální. Nemyslel bych si, že devadesátiminutová sekvence statických fotografií s hudbou, zvukovými efekty a vyprávěním může tak dobře fungovat. (Ilča 70 %)
articles.title: Audio recenze: Ještě nejsem, kým chci být - 80 %

articles.author: noreply@blogger.com (Unknown)
articles.description: Kvalitní herecké výkony a režie, ale v ostatních ohledech (např. scénář, kamera...) nic zajímavého. Hlavní hrdinka se trápí, trápí, a trápí... až je konec. Trápení je v průběhu filmu trochu permutováno, ale jde pouze o střípky, které (záměrně?) nevytvářejí žádný dramatický celek, natož zápletku. (Ilča 50 %)
articles.title: Audio recenze: Rok vdovy - 70 %

articles.author: noreply@blogger.com (Unknown)
articles.description: Z dosavadních Eggersových filmů je tento nejméně autorský, nejméně konzistentní a nejvíce působí jako kdyby do jeho vzniku někdo kecal ohledně jeho komerčního potenciálu. Výsledek je tudíž poněkud schizofrenní, chvíli artový, chvíli komerční, a nepříjemně rozvleklý. (Ilča 70 %)
articles.title: Audio recenze: Nosferatu - 60 %

articles.author: noreply@blogger.com (Unknown)

Persona 5

articles.title: Podcast: Tahové JRPG videohry

articles.author: noreply@blogger.com (Unknown)
articles.description: Učebnicový příklad toho, jak někdo viděl fungující originál ("Sentimental", Španělsko 2020) a natočil jeho český "srandovnější" remake, aniž by chápal proč a jak ten originál fungoval. (Ilča 30 %)
articles.title: Audio recenze: V dobrém i zlém - 20 %

articles.author: noreply@blogger.com (Unknown)
articles.description: "Bohužel" tento film není tak špatný, aby byl zábavný. Je to jen nuda, která není vůbec ničím zajímavá. Takhle nějak si představuji, že budou vypadat stoprocentně AI generované filmy. Nejzajímavější a nejzábavnější je malá role Russella Crowea.  (Ilča 40 %)
articles.title: Audio recenze: Lovec Kraven [Kraven The Hunter] - 40 %

articles.author: noreply@blogger.com (Unknown)
articles.description: Někdo napsal scénář s cool zápletkami a dialogy, někdo vymodeloval úžasná prostředí, někdo složil hudbu a nahrál dialogy skoro jako John Williams a Harrison Ford... To všechno funguje velmi dobře. Ale je to proloženo otravnou hrou, kde pořádně nefunguje boj, stealth ani puzzly, a jejíž interaktivita zdržuje od toho cool příběhu.
articles.title: Skororecenze: Indiana Jones and the Great Circle
